title: Hotel Manager Job at Efezi Southsea Nigeria Limited
content:
Established in 2009, Efezi Southsea Nigeria Limited is a hospitality consultancy firm specializing in providing expert services to small and medium-sized hotels.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Manager

Job Location: Ijiya - Ijokoro, Lagos

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Hotel Manager is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the hotel, ensuring exceptional guest experiences, managing staff performance, maintaining profitability, and upholding the brand’s standards.
	The role requires leadership, financial acumen, and operational expertise to manage all departments and drive continuous improvement.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Supervise and coordinate activities across all departments, including front office, housekeeping, food and beverage, maintenance, and security.
	Ensure smooth daily operations and promptly address operational challenges.


Guest Experience:


	Maintain high standards of service quality to ensure guest satisfaction.
	Resolve customer complaints and handle special requests promptly and professionally.


Staff Management:


	Recruit, train, supervise, and evaluate hotel staff.
	Promote teamwork, discipline, and staff motivation.
	Schedule staff shifts and ensure adequate coverage across all departments.


Financial Oversight:


	Prepare and manage budgets, control costs, and monitor revenues and expenses.
	Analyze financial performance and implement strategies to meet profitability targets.
	Approve purchases, monitor inventory, and manage supplier relationships.


Sales and Marketing Support:


	Collaborate with the sales/marketing team to promote the hotel, boost occupancy, and increase revenue.
	Implement guest loyalty programs and promotional campaigns.


Compliance and Standards:


	Ensure compliance with health, safety, labor laws, and hospitality regulations.
	Uphold and enforce hotel policies, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and brand guidelines.


Facility Management:


	Oversee the upkeep of the hotel premises, including cleanliness, maintenance, and aesthetics.
	Coordinate with maintenance teams for prompt repairs and upgrades.


Reporting and Communication:


	Provide regular reports to owners or the board on operational, financial, and staffing matters.
	Maintain effective internal communication with department heads and senior management.


Required Qualifications & Skills:


	Education: Degree or diploma in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related fields.
	Experience: 3–5+ years of experience in hotel operations or hospitality leadership roles.
	Skills:
	
		Strong leadership and decision-making abilities.
		Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
		Financial and analytical skills.
		Customer service orientation.
		Ability to manage pressure and multitask.
	
	


Applicants must reside in or around the following locations:


	Agbado-Crossing
	Abule-Egba
	Meiran
	Agbado-Ijaiye
	Jankara
	Agege
	Ogba
	Iyana Ipaja
	Kola
	Tollgate
	Oko-Aba axis.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: efezisouthsea2000@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Restaurant Manager Job at Marriott International
content:
Marriott International is a leading global Lodging company based in Bethesda, Maryland, USA, with more than 4,100 properties in 79 countries and reported revenues of nearly $14 billion in fiscal year 2014. Its heritage can be traced to a root beer stand opened in Washington, D.C., in 1927 by J. Willard and Alice S. Marriott.

Marriott has more than 361,000 people working worldwide at managed or franchised properties and corporate offices. Marriott has been consistently recognized as a top employer and for its superior business ethics. The company also manages the award-winning guest loyalty program, Marriott Rewards® and The Ritz-Carlton Rewards® program, which together surpass 49M members.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	Areas of responsibility include Restaurants/Bars and Room Service, if applicable.
	Supervises daily restaurant operations and assists with menu planning, maintains sanitation standards and assists servers and hosts on the floor during peak meal periods.
	Strives to continually improve guest and employee satisfaction and maximize the financial performance in areas of responsibility.
	Determines training needed to accomplish goals, then implements plan.


Core Work Activities
Managing Day-to-Day Operations:


	Supervises and manages employees. Manages all day-to-day operations. Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence.
	Maintains service and sanitation standards in restaurant, bar/lounge and room service areas.
	Reviews staffing levels to ensure that guest service, operational needs and financial objectives are met.


Leading Food and Beverage Team:


	Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.
	Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
	Serves as a role model to demonstrate appropriate behaviors.
	Identifies the developmental needs of others and coaches, mentors, or otherwise helps others to improve their knowledge or skills.
	Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
	Ensures and maintains the productivity level of employees.
	Provides the leadership, vision and direction to bring together and prioritize the departmental goals in a way that will be efficient and effective.
	Ensures compliance with all food & beverage policies, standards and procedures by training, supervising, follow-up and hands on management.
	Ensures compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
	Ensures compliance with food handling and sanitation standards.
	Ensures staff understands local, state and Federal liquor laws.
	Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with employees and ensures employees do the same within the team.
	Establishes guidelines so employees understand expectations and parameters.
	Monitors alcohol beverage service in compliance with local laws.


Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service:


	Provides services that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.
	Improves service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand guest needs, providing guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed.
	Manages day-to-day operations, ensures the quality, standards and meets the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.
	Displays leadership in guest hospitality, exemplifies excellent customer service and creates a positive atmosphere for guest relations.
	Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service.
	Acts as the guest service role model for the restaurants, sets a good example of excellent customer service and creates a positive atmosphere for guest relations.


Handles guest problems and complaints:


	Meets with guests on an informal basis during meals or upon departure to obtain feedback on quality of food and beverage, service levels and overall satisfaction.
	Ensures corrective action is taken to continuously improve service results.
	Incorporates guest satisfaction as a component of departmental meetings with a focus on continuous improvement.
	Manages service delivery in outlets to ensure excellent service from point of entry to departure (e.g., greeting from hostess, speed of order taking and food and beverage delivery, fulfillment of special requests, collection of payment & invitation to return).


Managing and Conducting Human Resource Activities:


	Provides guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.
	Identifies the educational needs of others, develops formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaches or instructs others.
	Ensures employees are treated fairly and equitably. Strives to improve employee retention.
	Ensures employees receive on-going training to understand guest expectations.
	Solicits employee feedback, utilizes an "open door" policy and reviews employee satisfaction results to identify and address employee problems or concerns.
	Strives to improve service performance.
	Ensures recognition is taking place across areas of responsibility.


Additional Responsibilities:


	Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.
	Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
	Assists servers and hosts on the floor during meal periods and high demand times.
	Recognizes good quality products and presentations.
	Supervises daily shift operations in absence of Assistant Restaurant Manager.
	Oversees the financial aspects of the department including purchasing and payment of invoices.


Candidates Profile
Education and Experience:


	High school diploma or GED; 4 years experience in the food and beverage, culinary, or related professional area.


OR


	2-year degree from an accredited university in Food Service Management, Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major; 2 years of experience in the food and beverage, culinary, or related professional area.

title: Data Entry Officer Job at G-Shoppers
content:
G-Shoppers provide easy food shopping support to homes, career men, and women and business people who are faced with the challenge of being constantly away from home and have less or no time to shop as well as cook. We execute orders to supply food stuff and items such as fresh meat, sea foods, frozen, dry foods, vegetables, fruits, and prepped ready to cook food ingredients. We are based in portharcourt.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Entry Officer
Job Location: Eliozu, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking to hire a detail-oriented and organized Data Entry Executive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for accurately entering, updating, and maintaining data in our systems.


Responsibilities


	Enter data accurately and efficiently into the company's database or information management system.
	Ensure all data entries are done accurately and closed out daily.
	Review and verify data for accuracy and completeness before submission.
	Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and adhere to data protection regulations.
	Identify and correct errors in data entry processes to improve efficiency.
	Collaborate with other team members to ensure timely completion of data-related tasks.
	Update existing records as necessary and ensure that all information is current.
	Generate reports based on entered data and assist in data analysis when required.
	Assist in training new employees on data entry processes and best practices.
	Perform other administrative tasks as assigned by the supervisor.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess minimum of Bachelor's Degrees with 1+ years of relevant work experience
	Must reside in or around Eliozu.
	Strong communication, memorization, and teamwork skills.
	Capacity to perform your duties diligently, particularly during stressful situations.
	Should be willing to work 25days a month
	Should be willing to work with the company long term.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications and CV to: gshoppersinventory@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Candidates should indicate their location in Port Harcourt.

title: Senior Human Resource Manager Job at Patrisan Jozzy Recruitment
content:
Patrisan Jozzy Recruitment - Our client, a leading Company in the Logistics industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Human Resource Manager 

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client is seeking for an experienced Senior Human Resource manager with industry experience.


Responsibilties
The HR manager will be responsible for:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Strategic HR Leadership: Develop and implement HR policies, programs, and initiatives that support the company's strategic goals within the unique context of the logistics industry.
	Talent Acquisition & Management: Oversee the full recruitment lifecycle, with a particular focus on attracting, hiring, and onboarding qualified personnel for logistics roles, ensuring timely fulfillment of staffing needs.
	Employee Relations: Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues, fostering a fair, consistent, and positive working environment. Provide guidance to management and employees on disciplinary actions, grievances, and conflict resolution.
	Performance Management: Implement and manage performance appraisal systems, ensuring fair and effective evaluation, feedback, and development plans for all staff, including performance metrics relevant to logistics operations.
	Compensation & Benefits: Administer compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitiveness and compliance with labor laws, including specific considerations for various logistics roles.
	Training & Development: Identify training needs specific to the logistics sector and coordinate professional development programs.
	Compliance & Safety: Ensure compliance with all national and local labor laws and industry-specific regulations. Collaborate with operations to reinforce a strong safety culture and manage HR aspects of workplace safety in a logistics environment.
	HR Operations: Manage HR administrative functions, maintain accurate employee records, and leverage HR technology for efficiency.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in Human Resources, with at least 3 years specifically as an HR Manager within the logistics, transportation, or warehousing industry.This industry-specific experience is essential.
	A Master's degree or professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM-CP/SCP) is a strong plus.
	Demonstrable knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices in Nigeria
	Proven ability to manage the recruitment, training, and retention challenges unique to the logistics sector.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills (written and verbal).
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, demanding operational environment.
	Proficiency in HRIS and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susaneze5@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Logistics Industry experience is a must.
